alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 12:53PM CDT until April 16 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... St. Croix River at Danbury affecting Burnett and Pine Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt the snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO LATE SUNDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Croix River AT Danbury. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Minor low land flooding. Boat ramp at confluence of Yellow River underwater. Considered bankfull stage. At 7.0 feet, Water begins to spread into picnic grounds near the gage near Highway 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 4.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening to a crest of 7.6 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 07/13/2016. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat St. Croix River Danbury 7.0 4.9 Wed 11 am CD 6.5 7.5 7.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening by 700 PM CDT.
